intro: Hieracium tuixentianum, commonly known as the Tuixentian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium tuixentianum is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in local ecosystems.
